page.title: 14Elton's Women's Institute
page.content: A Women's Institute is an association of the women of a village or small country town.The first WI was formed in Canada in 1897.Elton WI was formed 53 years ago.To commemorate 50 years, Elton WI gave the village a splendid village sign, carved in wood and painted.The WI meets monthly on Thursday evenings at the Highgate Hall.There is usually a speaker on subjects such as:-Make Up,Crime Prevention, Flower Arangement,Radio Broadcast,Travel,American Air Force wives on "Life in England" and many others.On other occasions there are excursions such as a visit to the theatre,African violet centre, amateur operatic performances and in October this year a guided tour of the House of Commons by our local Member of Parliament Mr John Major.{ {
